newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-RBA says wage growth may have peaked.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-RBA says wage growth may have peaked.

text.p: Reserve Bank of Australia governor Ian Macfarlane said on Thursday that wage rises under the decentralised enterprise bargaining system may have peaked.
Macfarlane said that many managers had not adjusted to the new decentralised system, unlike the union movement, and had in effect granted higher than necessary rises.
But managers were now beginning to adjust to the new system and were negotiating wage deals that companies could afford.
"I could be that a peak in enterprise bargains (wages growth) has been reached," he said in testimony to a federal parliamentary committee.

He repeated comments from the central bank's semi-annual statement on monetary policy, tabled earlier, that higher wages growth from the decentralised system could force the RBA's hand on monetary policy.
The RBA has set wages growth of 4.5 percent or thereabouts as the ceiling beyond which it would take policy action. Wages rises are now running at between four and five percent annually.
